tit.e: Murasakino Senke-ryu (a school of Tea Ceremony)
Murasakino Senke-ryu (a school of Tea Ceremony)
Murasakino Senke school (a school of tea ceremony)
tit.cmt: 千家流→Senke school としました。

sen.j: 武家流紫野千家流（むらさきのせんけりゅう）は、尾張徳川家の家老家に伝わった今沢流の系譜と考えられている。
sen.e: "Buke Murasakino Senke-ryu" is considered to have descended from Imasawa-ryu school inherited by the family of Karo (chief retainer) of the Owari Tokugawa family.
"Buke Murasakino Senke-ryu" is considered to have descended from Imasawa-ryu school inherited by the family of Karo (chief retainer) of the Owari Tokugawa family.
Buke style (samurai style) Murasakino Senke school is considered to have descended from Imasawa school inherited by the family of karo (chief retainer) of the Owari Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: 武家流→Buke style としました。

sen.j: 長く防衛大学校茶道部などで習流してきたが、平成18年に初代家元秋野月紫が亡くなり、防衛大学校茶道部はその後継者として表千家流を迎えることとなった。
sen.e: After being commonly practiced for a long time at Sado-bu (a Tea Ceremony club) in the National Defense Academy, the school decided to receive a new head from the Omote-Senke school as a successor to their first head, Gesshi AKINO, when he died in 2006.

After being commonly practiced for a long time at Sado-bu (a Tea Ceremony club) in the National Defense Academy, the school decided to receive a new head from the Omote-Senke school as a successor to their first head, Gesshi AKINO, when he died in 2006.

After being commonly practiced for a long time at Sado club (a tea ceremony club) in the National Defense Academy, the school decided to receive a new head from the Omotesenke school as a successor to their first head, Gesshi AKINO (秋野月紫), when he died in 2006.
sen.cmt: 人名の読みが不明のため、漢字を追記しました。

sen.j: また別に同名の流派もあるがどこの流れかは不明。
sen.e: There is another school with the same name, but nothing is known about their linealogy.

sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.j: はじめ、秋野月紫は尾張徳川家家老家に伝わる大徳寺派の流れをくむ今沢流で修行をした。
sen.e: At first, Gesshi AKINO got his training at Imasawa-ryu school, a lineage of Daitoku-ji school which had been inherited by the Karo (first retainer) family of Owari Tokugawa family.
At first, Gesshi AKINO got his training at Imasawa-ryu school, a lineage of Daitoku-ji school which had been inherited by the Karo (first retainer) family of Owari Tokugawa family.
At first, Gesshi AKINO got his training at Imasawa school, a lineage of Daitokuji school which had been inherited by the karo family of Owari Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: 既出単語の説明を削除しました。

sen.j: 後に今沢流の家元がなくなり、茶道の流派としては消滅したので、表千家・大日本茶道学会といった流派を移りながら稽古することになった。
sen.e: Subsequently, when the head of Imasawa-ryu school died and the school itself ceased to exist, he continued training himself of the Tea Ceremony at Omote-Senke, Dainihon Chado Gakkai (Japan Association of the Tea Ceremony) and other schools.

Subsequently, when the head of Imasawa-ryu school died and the school itself ceased to exist, he continued training himself of the Tea Ceremony at Omote-Senke, Dainihon Chado Gakkai (Japan Association of the Tea Ceremony) and other schools.

Subsequently, when the head of Imasawa school died and the school itself ceased to exist, he continued training himself of the tea ceremony at Omotesenke school, Dainihon Chado Gakkai (Japan Association of the Tea Ceremony) and other schools.

sen.j: 結局、表千家の顧問から「自分でやったほうがいいだろう」といわれ、流派をひらいた。
sen.e: Eventually, he set up a new school of the Tea Ceremony following an advise of a councilor of Omote-Senke school that he had better cultivate his own way of the Tea Ceremony.
Eventually, he set up a new school of the Tea Ceremony following an advise of a councilor of Omote-Senke school that he had better cultivate his own way of the Tea Ceremony.
Eventually, he set up a new school of the tea ceremony following an advise of a councilor of Omotesenke school that he had better cultivate his own way of the tea ceremony.
sen.cmt: Omotesenke としました。tea ceremony 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 今沢流が基盤のためか武家風の古風なお点前である。
sen.e: Probably because his new school was based on Imasawa-ryu school, its tea serving manner was of conservative samurai style.
Probably because his new school was based on Imasawa-ryu school, its tea serving manner was of conservative samurai style.
Probably because his new school was based on Imasawa school, its tea serving manner was of conservative samurai style.

sen.j: 昭和30年から平成18年まで防衛大学校茶道部にて教えていた。
sen.e: From 1955 to 2006, he had been an instructor of the Tea Ceremony at Chado club of the National Defense Academy.
From 1955 to 2006, he had been an instructor of the Tea Ceremony at Chado club of the National Defense Academy.
From 1955 to 2006, he had been an instructor of the tea ceremony at Sado club of the National Defense Academy.
sen.cmt: tea ceremony 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 初代の死後も、その娘や弟子を中心に自衛隊駐屯所や一般教室にて習流が続く。
sen.e: Even after the decease of the first head of this school, parctices of his school were continued mainly by his daughter and disciples with other followers of the school at the National Defense Academy and other places.

Even after the decease of the first head of this school, parctices of his school were continued mainly by his daughter and disciples with other followers of the school at the National Defense Academy and other places.

Even after the decease of the first head, practices of his school are continued mainly by his daughter and disciples with other followers of the school at army posts of the Self-Defense Forces and other classes.
sen.cmt: 駐屯所 追加しました。

sen.j: 現在は紫野流と名乗っている。
sen.e: At present, the school is called Murasakino-ryu.
